headline.print_headline: Vast F.D.A. Effort Tracked E-Mails Of Its Scientists
headline.seo: F.D.A. Surveillance of Scientists Spread to Outside Critics
headline.main: Vast F.D.A. Effort Tracked E-Mails of Its Scientists

docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration captured thousands of messages sent by disgruntled scientists to lawmakers, lawyers and even President Obama....

keywords.value: United States Office of Special Counsel
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Investigation into the possible leaking of confidential Food and Drug Administration information by 5 agency scientists turned into a much broader campaign to counter outside critics of its medical review process turning up thousands of once confidential records; FDA officials defend the wide surveillance operation, saying that it focused only on the scientists suspected of leaking information about the safety and design of medical devices.

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and SCOTT SHANE

docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration captured thousands of messages sent by disgruntled scientists to lawmakers, lawyers and even President Obama.

headline.print_headline: Scandal at Penn State Leaves the N.C.A.A. With Difficult Decisions
headline.seo: Penn State Scandal Poses Tough Choices for N.C.A.A.
headline.main: Scandal at Penn State Poses Tough Choices for N.C.A.A.

docs.snippet: The N.C.A.A. could impose serious sanctions, perhaps even forcing the football program to shut down for a time. But the organization is reluctant to issue its so-called death penalty....
docs.abstract: NCAA could impose serious sanctions against Penn State over the Jerry Sandusky scandal, perhaps even forcing the football program to shut down for a time.
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. could impose serious sanctions, perhaps even forcing the football program to shut down for a time. But the organization is reluctant to issue its so-called death penalty.

headline.print_headline: California County Considers a Rescue Plan for Struggling Homeowners
headline.seo: A County Considers Rescue of Underwater Homes
headline.main: California County Weighs Drastic Plan to Aid Homeowners

docs.snippet: San Bernardino County, with some of the nation’s highest foreclosure rates, may use eminent domain to buy up mortgages and cut them to the current value of the homes....

keywords.value: Securities Industry and Financial Markets Assn
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: San Bernardino County, Calif, with some of the nation’s highest foreclosure rates, may use eminent domain to buy up mortgages and cut them to the current value of the homes; county could hopefully resell the mortgages to a private investment firm, which would allow homeowners to lower their monthly payments and hang onto their property; county is a long way off from putting the policy in place, but idea has rankled banks.
docs.lead_paragraph: San Bernardino County, with some of the nation’s highest foreclosure rates, may use eminent domain to buy up mortgages and cut them to the current value of the homes.

headline.print_headline: Many Governors Are Still Unsure About Medicaid Expansion
headline.seo: Governors Face Hard Choices Over Medicaid Expansion
headline.main: Many Governors Are Still Unsure About Medicaid Expansion

docs.snippet: Although initial reactions to the Supreme Court’s ruling that Medicaid expansion was up to individual states was along party lines, subsequent responses are more nuanced....

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Initial reactions by governors to the Supreme Court’s ruling that Medicaid expansion is up to individual states are split along party lines, but subsequent responses are more nuanced; most governors in both parties at the National Governors Association meeting say they are unsure and need to study how to proceed with their Medicaid programs.
docs.lead_paragraph: Although initial reactions to the Supreme Court’s ruling that Medicaid expansion was up to individual states was along party lines, subsequent responses are more nuanced.

docs.snippet: On pace to lose 100 games, the Rockies decided to go with a four-man rotation and limit starters to 75 pitches. The results have been mixed....
docs.abstract: Colorado Rockies decide to with a four-man rotation and limit starters to 75 pitches, with mixed results; team was on pace to lose 100 games when they made the change and have gone 9-12 since.
docs.lead_paragraph: On pace to lose 100 games, the Rockies decided to go with a four-man rotation and limit starters to 75 pitches. The results have been mixed.

headline.print_headline: German Wins Again; Wiggins Retains Lead
headline.seo: 2012 Tour de France — Andre Greipel of Germany Wins His Third Stage
headline.main: German Wins Again; Wiggins Retains Lead

docs.snippet: Andre Greipel of Germany led a sprint to win the 13th stage of the Tour de France, and Bradley Wiggins of Britain retained the overall lead....
docs.abstract: Andre Greipel of Germany wins the 13th stage of the Tour de France, and Bradley Wiggins of Britain retains the overall lead.
docs.lead_paragraph: Andre Greipel of Germany led a sprint to win the 13th stage of the Tour de France, and Bradley Wiggins of Britain retained the overall lead.

headline.print_headline: French President Wants Private Lives Kept Private
headline.seo: French President Wants Private Affairs Kept Private
headline.main: French President Wants Private Lives Kept Private

docs.snippet: François Hollande wants those close to him to resolve their conflicts away from the media spotlight....
docs.abstract: Francois Hollande, the new French president, says that he has told those close to him to keep their private lives private and to resolve their conflicts away from the news media; he has been embarrassed by the evident strain between his partner, Valerie Trierweiler, and his four children, whom he fathered with former Socialist presidential candidate, Segolene Royal.
docs.lead_paragraph: François Hollande wants those close to him to resolve their conflicts away from the media spotlight.

headline.print_headline: Home Has Been No Advantage for Englishmen at Open
headline.seo: Home Soil Is No Advantage for English Golfers at Open
headline.main: Home Has Been No Advantage for Englishmen at Open

docs.snippet: Few golfers from England have won the British Open on their native courses. Luke Donald, Lee Westwood and Justin Rose are faced with that task this week....
docs.abstract: Dave Anderson Sports of The Times column observes that few golfers from England have won the British Open on their native courses; Luke Donald, Lee Westwood and Justin Rose are facing that task this year.
docs.lead_paragraph: Few golfers from England have won the British Open on their native courses. Luke Donald, Lee Westwood and Justin Rose are faced with that task this week.

headline.print_headline: New Details of a Battle Challenge Reports of a Syrian Massacre
headline.seo: Details of a Battle Challenge Reports of a Syrian Massacre
headline.main: Details of a Battle Challenge Reports of a Syrian Massacre

docs.snippet: New information about what local activists called a massacre of civilians indicated it was more likely a clash between the Syrian military and rebel fighters....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: New details about what local Syrian activists call a massacre of civilians near the central city of Hama indicate that it was more likely an uneven clash between the heavily armed Syrian military and local fighters bearing light weapons; United Nations observers send a team to the village of Tremseh to investigate.
docs.lead_paragraph: New information about what local activists called a massacre of civilians indicated it was more likely a clash between the Syrian military and rebel fighters.

headline.print_headline: A Chance to Bond In a Solitary Sport
headline.seo: World Team Tennis Is Bonding Time, and a Proving Ground
headline.main: A Chance to Bond in a Solitary Sport

docs.snippet: World Team Tennis, a midsummer league championed by Billie Jean King, is a chance for young pros to grow, and for big names to connect with fans....
docs.abstract: World Team Tennis, a midsummer league championed by Billie Jean King, is a chance for young pros to grow, and for big names to connect with fans.
docs.lead_paragraph: World Team Tennis, a midsummer league championed by Billie Jean King, is a chance for young pros to grow, and for big names to connect with fans.
